> This weapon falls into the [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades") category. It is a one handed weapon.

**Demon blades** are one of the best one-handed Long Blades you can find. Although [double swords](/Double_sword "Double sword") deal more damage, demon blades are slightly faster, with roughly the same damage/turn.

Worshippers of [good](/Good "Good") [gods](/God "God") cannot attack with them without suffering [penance](/Penance "Penance"). However, worshippers [the Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One") can convert a demon blade into a [eudemon blade](/Eudemon_blade "Eudemon blade"), with better stats and the [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") brand. You can reverse the process with [Kikubaaqudgha](/Kikubaaqudgha "Kikubaaqudgha")'s or [Lugonu](/Lugonu "Lugonu")'s blessing.

## Strategy

Demon weapons are often found on the [hell knights](/Hell_knight "Hell knight") in the [Depths](/Depths "Depths") and the [Vestibule of Hell](/Vestibule_of_Hell "Vestibule of Hell"), often with good [enchantment](/Enchant "Enchant") levels and [brands](/Brand "Brand").

### Compared to double sword

On most species, [double swords](/Double_sword "Double sword") are mostly equivalent to demon blades. If both weapons are at minimum delay, a +0 demon blade is 1% stronger than a +0 double sword against a 0 AC opponent. As the demon blade attacks faster, it is penalized more by [AC](/AC "AC"), though it benefits more from [slaying](/Slaying "Slaying") and [auxiliary attacks](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack").

Overall, the differences are too small to make an impact. A +9 demon blade is enough to win you the game, as is a +9 double sword. Generally, the sword you get *first* should be the sword that you use. (The sword you get first can benefit first from [scrolls of enchant weapon](/Scrolls_of_enchant_weapon "Scrolls of enchant weapon")).

For small species ([Kobold](/Kobold "Kobold") and [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan")), the demon blade will usually come out ahead, because it does not use the shield slot.

## History

- In [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Long Blades lost [riposte](/Riposte "Riposte"). Damage was increased back to pre-riposte levels.
- In [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), Long Blades gained riposte. Demon blades were reduced by 1 base damage to compensate.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), demon blades dealt slightly more damage than normal in the hands of [demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") characters.
